Reviews.Title: The Best TV Value for your Money
Reviews.Author: Dennis F. Lasanen
Reviews.Content: I purchased the TV on Monday, October 15, 2012 from a local Big Lots Department.  The television far exceeds all of my personal expectations.  The picture is very clear and vivid, on the preset factory settings and was also set to energy savings.  It has a $11.00 yearly energy electric estimate based on 5 hours of everyday usage and 11 cents per kilo watt hour.  In addition it is PC Connection compatible. Page 25 of the Owners Manual (or refer to [...] to the 26" LCD TV Model LC260EM2) , " This unit can be connected to your PC that has a DVI terminal.  Use a HDM1-DVI conversion cable for this connection an it requires stereo mini plug conversion cables as well.  If you connect this unit to your PC, you can use this unit as a PC monitor."  A diagram is included to show how to make the connections. Their is also a 26" Emerson that includes a built in DVD Player.  I have Time Warner Cable and have noticed an overall improvement in picture quality.

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: noname
Reviews.Content: Easy to set-up, nice picture - DVD was a bonus to me as I did not realize I ordered the one with the DVD.  TV is very user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Beware - Power Issues are Common
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: First of all, when functioning this TV is awesome. It has all the basics, 2 HDMI ports, great picture and sound. I love it.However, after 8 months of use it just shut off. I tried to reset it according to the instructions, and it turned on and then cut off again after 5 minutes. After that, nothing I did could get it to turn back on. Luckily, I purchased this from Walmart with a protection plan, and filed a claim and got it fixed for free. After a quick google search, power board issues are very common among some of the Emerson TVs. I don't know what the Amazon warranty covers and what the price is, but I would definitely get some kind of protection plan with this TV so you don't end up paying out of pocket for  a manufacturer's defect.

Reviews.Title: Don't bother. This is not worth it.
Reviews.Author: Suellen Dosch "Sue loves soc"
Reviews.Content: I thought I was getting a great deal. The picture is fair but not great. The sound is awful. My clock radio has better sound. I am not buying the extra protection. When this goes out it's going in the garbage! So sorry I wasted my money....

Reviews.Title: 4.5 out of 5 stars
Reviews.Author: john proia
Reviews.Content: I give 4.5 out of 5.only thing wrong is the picture is a tiny tiny bit hazy but barely negligible. Still an excellent buy

Reviews.Title: Worth the bucks
Reviews.Author: N. Fulkerson
Reviews.Content: For the price, very good TV.....even though it is not a brand name. Picture is very clear and sound acceptable.
